# PR Summary

This change allows users to tab complete both named and numerical values for the Scope parameter. This PR addresses issue #8106. This applies to all cmdlets that use the scope parameter as specified by the issue, including:
- Remove-PSDrive
- Get-PSDrive
- New-PSDrive
- Clear-Variable
- Get-Variable
- Remove-Variable
- Set-Variable
- Get-Alias
- Export-Alias
- Import-Alias
- New-Alias
- New-Variable
- Remove-Alias
- Set-Alias

## PR Context

This change modifies the [System.Management.Automation.CommandCompletion]::CompleteInput method to work appropriately with the Scope parameter. For example, if it is called in a certain scope with no specific word to complete (suppose 0, 1, and 2 are valid scope values), the method will return 0, 1, and 2, along with "global", "local", and "script". These latter three values may always be returned, regardless of the current scope.

A method CompletionCompleters.cs:NativeCompletionScope was added (with a helper method CompletionCompleters.cs:CompleteScope), and the implementation details are similar to the existing NativeCompletion* methods. 

Note that when users actually perform the tab completion in Powershell, some scope numbers that are out of range are returned. This is an issue with how the results from the CompleteInput method are used, and would involve future changes.

The added test checks that the CompleteInput method appropriately tab-completes Scope values at the script level as well as the single, double, and triple nested function level. In addition, each cmdlet listed above is tested for this.
